Detailed Description

Controls an instance of the CiplCtlMgr.

A more elaborate description.

1) Create a Manager Instance, see LPFN_CoCreateCiplManager.
2) Open Manager  	
	ICiplCtlMgr::Open(CIPLCTLMGR_OPEN_FLAG_DEVICECOLLECTION_ASYNC,tcEscape);
3) Create Session	
	ICiplCtlMgr::CreateObject(CIPLCTLMGR_OBJECT_TYPE_SESSION,NULL,0); 
4) Select window   
		CSampleWindow sw;
		ICiplCtlMgr::SelectExternalObject(NULL,CIPLCTLMGR_OBJECT_TYPE_WINDOW,sw.GetHwnd());
5) Then open source (select url or select file need not specify device)
	ICiplCtlMgr::ExecuteImmediateCmdString(NULL,_T("open file c:/any.avi"), szReturn, ARRAYSIZE(szReturn), &dwFilled)
6) [Play/Pause/Etc]
	ICiplCtlMgr::ExecuteImmediateCmdString(NULL,_T("play"), szReturn, ARRAYSIZE(szReturn), &dwFilled);
7) Close Source
	ICiplCtlMgr::ExecuteImmediateCmdString(NULL,_T("close"), szReturn, ARRAYSIZE(szReturn), &dwFilled);
8) Destroy Session
	ICiplCtlMgr::DestroyObject(CIPLCTLMGR_OBJECT_TYPE_SESSION,NULL);
9) Close Manager
	ICiplCtlMgr::Close();
10) Release Manager
	ICiplCtlMgr::Release();	// part of IUnknown
The command interpreter is run through passing in strings to
ICiplCtlMgr::ExecuteImmediateCmdString()
The command list:
1) Basic control/creating session, opening source
CONTROL / DEVICE LEVEL
	create session (SessionName)	// ICiplCtlMgr::CreateObject(CIPLCTLMGR_OBJECT_TYPE_SESSION,(SessionName),0);
	destroy session [(SessionName)]	// ICiplCtlMgr::DestroyObject(CIPLCTLMGR_OBJECT_TYPE_SESSION,(SessionName)); if (SessionName) is not specified, is the default calling session
	select
		session [(SessionName)]  if (SessionName) is not specified, NULL is used.
		window (internal [(WindowName)] | external (hwnd_ptr_as_integer))
	wait 
		devicemanager [(Number_msec_timeout)]
	show
		device [(Number)]		// without number, shows all devices
		session					// shows all the sessions available
	open
		device
			(Number) | CMMB | DVB | DTMB | ISDBT | ATSC | DMB | DAB
		url (URLname)
		file (Filename)
	close
	get
		cdevice					// (Number) returns integer - current device index
		session					// (DefaultSessionName) returns string
	sleep (Number)				// sleeps number of msec.  Included for testing, not recommended for general use.
2) Tuning (after session created and source is opened)
TUNER
	startscan
		file
		http (url)
		(Number_StartKhz) (Number_EndKhz) (Number_BandwidthKhz)
		region (country code) (region id)
	stopscan
	storescan path
	restorescan path
	cleanscan path
	wait 
		scan [(Number_msec_timeout)]
		device [(Number_msec_timeout)]		
	show
		service [(Number)]		// without number, shows all services
		program [(Number)]		// without number, shows current service program guide
		audio [(Number)]		// without number, shows current services audio menu
		subtitle [(Number)]		// without number, shows current services subtitle menu
		country					// shows supported country set for current standard
		region (Number)			// shows supported region set with input country code
	select
		service (Number)
		audio (Number)		
		subtitle (Number)		// if number is less than zero, disable all subtitles
	get
		cservice				// (Number) returns integer - current service index
		nservice				// (Number) returns integer number of services available
3) Then operate on the source
PLAYER LEVEL
	play
	pause
	resume					// often play can be called instead of resume
	stop					// this stops the player - note that a service indicator can be used as below
	start					// start service
		record [(Path)]
		ts [(Path)]
		// scheduler
	stop					// stop service
		record
		ts
		// scheduler
	thumbnail [(Number)]	// show thumbnail preview of this file, time in millisecond is optional for jumping to
	framestep				// show next video frame in pause mode
	set
		volume (Number)
		mute (Number)		// 1 or 0
		brightness (Number)
		contrast (Number)
		hue (Number)
		saturation (Number)
		gamma (Number)
		tsrange (Number)
		display (stretch | letterbox | crop)
		recordpath (Path)
		tspath (Path)
		snapshotpath (Path)
		syscachepath (Path)
		mediainfopath (Path)
		video (Number)		// 1 or 0, enables video or disables video
		position (Number)
		tsposition (Number)
		scan (Number)		// trick mode speed
		audiomode (stereo | left | right)
		parentalcontent (none | drugs | violence | sex)	
		parentalage (Number)
		destrect (left top right bottom)
		equalization (normal | pop | hiphop | rap | grunge | jazz | rock&roll | metal | dance | techno | classical | electronic | 
					  newage | folk | country | randb | blues | easylisten | oldies | reggae | opera | swing | speech | acoustic)
		timemode			// 1 or 0, enables stream time mode(1) or local time mode(0)
		recordspace			// number of disk space limitation in MB
		recordfilelimit	    // number of single record file limitation in MB
		subtitleoutput (disable | yuv420 | argb8888) // Output mode of raw subtitle data, for DVBT and ISDBT.
		videocodecmode (0|1|2) // Use hardware video codec or not
	get					// RETURNS VALUE
		volume			// (Number)
		mute			// (Number)		// 1 or 0
		brightness		// (Number)
		contrast		// (Number)
		hue				// (Number)
		saturation		// (Number)
		gamma			// (Number)
		tsrange			// (Number)
		display			// (String)		// (stretch | letterbox | crop)
		recordpath		// (String Path)
		tspath			// (String Path)
		snapshotpath	// (String Path)
		syscachepath	// (String Path)
		mediainfopath	// (String Path)
		video			// (Number)		// 1 or 0, enables video or disables video
		position		// (Number)
		tsposition		// (Number)
		scan			// (Number)		// trick mode speed (not implemented right now)
		duration		// (Number)
		uop				// (Number)
		uopmax			// (Number)
		state			// (Number)
		id3				// (String Blob)
		audioinfo		// (String Blob)
		videoinfo		// (String Blob)
		audiomode		// (String)		// (stereo | left | right)
		parentalcontent	// (String)		// (none | drugs | violence | sex)
		parentalage		// (Number)
		equalization    // (String)		// (normal | pop | hiphop | rap | grunge | jazz | rock&roll | metal | dance | techno | classical | electronic | 
											newage | folk | country | randb | blues | easylisten | oldies | reggae | opera | swing | speech | acoustic)
		timemode		// (Number)		// 1 or 0, enables stream time mode(1) or local time mode(0)
		recordspace		// (Number)		// number of disk space limitation in MB
		recordfilelimit	// (Number)		// number of single record file limitation in MB
		subtitleoutput  // (disable | yuv420 | argb8888)     // Output mode of raw subtitle data, for DVBT and ISDBT.
		videocodecmode  // (Number)     // The hardware video decoder mode, 0 for none hw codec, others for different hw codec.
	getrange			// RETURNS 3 values: min max default
		volume			// (Number_Min) (Number_Max) (Number_Default)
		brightness		// (Number_Min) (Number_Max) (Number_Default)
		contrast		// (Number_Min) (Number_Max) (Number_Default)
		hue				// (Number_Min) (Number_Max) (Number_Default)
		saturation		// (Number_Min) (Number_Max) (Number_Default)
		gamma			// (Number_Min) (Number_Max) (Number_Default)
		equalization    // (Number_Min) (Number_Max) (Number_Default) in dB
	setarray			//	
		equalization	val1 val2 val3... valn
		videorect		left top right bottom 
    getarray			//	RETURNS val1 val2 val3 .. .valn as a string
	    equalization    
		videorect
	getarraylabels		//	RETURNS name1(tab)name2(tab)...
	    eqalization 
		videorect
	getarraynum			//	RETURNS number of elements
		equalization
		videorect
	setarrayindex
		equalization index value
	getarrayindex		//	RETURNS value
		equalization index	
	adjust				//	RETURNS new value
		volume			// (Number_Adjustment)
		brightness		// (Number_Adjustment)
		contrast		// (Number_Adjustment)
		hue				// (Number_Adjustment)
		saturation		// (Number_Adjustment)
		gamma			// (Number_Adjustment)
	snapshot
		bmp [(Filename)]
		jpg [(Filename)]
		png [(Filename)]
	debug (Filename)
Return value:
All exeucte commands return strings (whether empty or not). 
Certain commands can return complex string values, for example the commands:
	get
	show
The string return value is called a string blob.
A string blob is a null terminated string, where '\t' (tab) and '\n' (newline)
characters are treated as special field delimters.
A (tab) character is used to delimit horizontal entries (or column index).
A (newline) character is used to delimit vertical entries (or row index).
A unique escape character may be chosen when opening the manager to properly
escape internally occuring tab and newline entries.  The escape character is
chosen by the programmer, typically C-Z or hex 0x1a, and is passed into the
OpenManager command and used in CSplitBlob or CUnescapeString.
The CSplitBlob class is used to extract out fields from the string blob.  In the
examples below, we will assume the following instance declaration:
	CSplitBlob sb(szReturn, tcEscape);
sb implements a stack allocated SplitBlob instance, which automatically parses szReturn
and unescapes all the fields with the tcEscape character.  The sb stack instance will be 
destroyed when conrol leaves the scope of the sb object, so be sure to use a heap
allocated CSplitBob instance, or copy any string that you extract from the stack allocated
SplitBlob, otherwise the will be automatically deleted.
	sb.GetItem(int nRow, int nCol) returns the string item at nRow or nCol or NULL if out of range.
	sb.GetNumberRows() returns the number of rows.
	sb.GetNumberCols(int nRow) returns the number of columns at nRow index.
	sb.IsArray() returns whether it is a 2D blob and printed as a vertical array.
Some examples of string blobs.
Singleton string:
A singleton string is null terminated and represents one
return value.  It may be empty but cannot contain unescaped tabs or newlines.
	(singleton)
	sb.GetItem(0,0) accesses this.
1D string array:
A 1D array is separated by tabs.  It shall not contain unescaped newlines. 
A 1D array without a tab is equivalent to a singleton string.
	(field0)(tab)(field1)(tab)(field2)
	sb.GetItem(0,n), where 0<=n<=2 accesses these fields.
2D string array:
A 2D array of entries is separated by tabs and newlines:
Each "row_line" is separated by a (newline).
Each "column_field" between the row is separated by a (tab).
A well formatted 2D string array always ends with a (newline) before
the null termination, however, in some cases the trailing(newline) is
omitted.  Nevertheless, a 2D string array must contain at least one (newline)
to distinguish that it is a 2D blob.
A 2D array with a single element must contain a newline.  Hence it
is distinct from a 1D row array or a singleton string.
Example 1x1 string blob:
	(line0_field0)(newline)
	sb.GetItem(0,0) accesses this field.
Example 1x3 string blob:
	(line0_field0)(tab)(line0_field1)(tab)(line0_field2)(newline)
	sb.GetItem(0,n), where 0<=n<=2 accesses these fields.
Example 4x4 string blob:
	(line0_field0)(tab)(line0_field1)(tab)(line0_field2)(tab)(line0_field3)(newline)
	(line1_field0)(tab)(line1_field1)(tab)(line1_field2)(tab)(line1_field3)(newline)
	(line2_field0)(tab)(line2_field1)(tab)(line2_field2)(tab)(line2_field3)(newline)
	(line3_field0)(tab)(line3_field1)(tab)(line3_field2)(tab)(line3_field3)(newline)
	sb.GetItem(m,n), where 0<=m,n<=3 accesses these fields. m is the
	row and n is the column.
Example variable size 2D blob:
	(line0_field0)(tab)(line0_field1)(newline)
	(newline)
	(line2_field0)(tab)(line1_field1)(tab)(line1_field2)(tab)(line1_field3)(newline)
	(line3_field0)(tab)(line2_field1)(tab)(line2_field2)(tab)(line2_field3)(newline)
	(line4_field0)(tab)(line3_field1)(tab)(line3_field2)(newline)
	sb.GetItem(m,n), accesses these items.  In this case there is
	an empty line, such as line1, sb.GetItem(1,0) returns the empty string.

Member Function Documentation

virtual HRESULT ICiplCtlMgr::Close ( ) [pure virtual]

Closes the Playback Manager and releases any run-time resources.

Returns:
CI_SOK on success.
CI_EFAIL on failure.
CI_EUNEXPECTED if manager has not been opened.

Implemented in CCtlMgr.

virtual HRESULT ICiplCtlMgr::CreateObject ( DWORD  dwType,
IN const TCHAR *  szName,
DWORD  dwFlags 
) [pure virtual]

Creates an internally managed object.

Parameters:
dwTypeis the Type of object to be created. Generally this is CIPLCTLMGR_OBJECT_TYPE_SESSION.
szNamethe name of the object to be created.
dwFlagsis any creation flags, generally 0.
Returns:
CI_SOK on success.
CI_EFAIL on failure.
CI_EUNEXPECTED if manager has not been opened.

Implemented in CCtlMgr.

virtual HRESULT ICiplCtlMgr::ExecuteImmediateCmdList ( IN const TCHAR *  szSession,
INT  argc,
IN const TCHAR *const *  argv,
OUT TCHAR *  szReturn = NULL,
UINT  ccReturn = 0,
OUT UINT *  pccFilled = NULL 
) [pure virtual]
Parameters:
szSessionis the session name. Use NULL for the null session or the default session.
argcis the command token count of the token list argv.
argvis a list of the command tokens. The token definitions are in the Reference manual.
szReturnis the return value of the last command in the argv list, a null terminated string. May be NULL if it is ignored.
ccReturnis size of szReturn in characters (not bytes). This is the entire buffer size. May be 0.
pccFilledis the number of characters written, not including the null character. May be NULL if not needed.
Returns:
CI_SOK on success.
CI_EFAIL on failure.
CI_EUNEXPECTED if manager has not been opened.

Implemented in CCtlMgr.

virtual HRESULT ICiplCtlMgr::ExecuteImmediateCmdString ( IN const TCHAR *  szSession,
IN const TCHAR *  szCommand,
OUT TCHAR *  szReturn = NULL,
UINT  ccReturn = 0,
OUT UINT *  pccFilled = NULL 
) [pure virtual]
Parameters:
szSessionis the session name. Use NULL for the null session or the default session.
szCommandis the command to be executed. Please see the reference manual for available commands.
szReturnis the return value of the last command in the argv list, a null terminated string. May be NULL if it is ignored.
ccReturnis size of szReturn in characters (not bytes). This is the entire buffer size. May be 0.
pccFilledis the number of characters written, not including the null character. May be NULL if not needed.
Returns:
CI_SOK on success.
CI_EFAIL on failure.
CI_EUNEXPECTED if manager has not been opened.

Implemented in CCtlMgr.

Gets an environment string.

pccFilledis the number of characters written, not including the null character.

virtual HRESULT ICiplCtlMgr::Open ( DWORD  dwFlags,
TCHAR  tcEscape 
) [pure virtual]

Opens the Playback Manager.

Parameters:
dwFlagsoptional flags, generally 0.
tcEscapeis the Escape character for return values. This is generally set to a control character such as 0x1a.
Returns:
CI_SOK on success.
CI_EFAIL on failure.
CI_EUNEXPECTED if manager has already opened.

Implemented in CCtlMgr.

virtual HRESULT ICiplCtlMgr::RegisterNotify ( IN LPVOID  pNotifyContext,
IN LPFN_CiplMgrNotifyCallback  pNotifyCallback 
) [pure virtual]

Registers an event notify callback function with the playback manager.

This is required to receive asynchronous notifications.

Parameters:
pNotifyContextis the context passed into the event notify callback.
pNotifyCallbackis the event notify callback function.
Returns:
CI_SOK on success.
CI_EFAIL on failure.

Implemented in CCtlMgr.

virtual HRESULT ICiplCtlMgr::SelectExternalObject ( IN const TCHAR *  szSession,
DWORD  dwType,
IN LPVOID  pObject 
) [pure virtual]

Selects the given external object to be the one used.

This function only works in very limited cases such as window handle objects.

Parameters:
szSessionis the session name. Use NULL for the null session or the default session.
dwTypeis the type of the object.
pObjectis a pointer to the externally managed object.
Returns:
CI_SOK on success.
CI_EFAIL on failure.
CI_EUNEXPECTED if manager has not been opened.

Implemented in CCtlMgr.
